subject: Re: [junit] Run it one by one
msgSnippet: ... Strange because JUnit is not programmed to work that way... One explanation I can find (without looking at your code) is that you call the setUp method
messageBody:
> Now I have some trouble. If I have 50 testcase, the JUnit always run setup() 50 times firstly, and then run the testcase one by one. But I need the JUnit to run ONE setup(), one testcase, and the next setup(), the next testcase. How can I do it?


Strange because JUnit is not programmed to work that way... One
explanation I can find (without looking at your code) is that you call
the setUp method within the test's constructor (the setUp method is
automatically executed so no need to call it elsewhere).

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Bossicard
www.bossicard.com
